questions.text: On what day does the show start?
questions.explanation:
Sunday.

	The Sunday was a week after football season started because they were all taking bets on the game.

questions.text: Who tutored Donna on how to handle herself during the questioning?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Donna was getting ready to leave and Sam was giving her some pointers on how to handle herself during the questioning.

questions.text: What book of the Bible did the Bartlet's discuss as they entered the White House?
questions.explanation:
Ephesians.

	Jed and Abbey were talking about Ephesians 5:21. Abbey told Charlie it was stupid that the Bible said, "Women be in subjection to your husbands" even though it was alright that the Bible said, "Husbands love your wives as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her."

questions.text: Who was going to take a bath and listen to Frank Sinatra?
questions.explanation:
Abbey.

	When Abbey said she was going to take a bath and turn on Frank Sinatra, Jed said, "How do you think Mrs. Sinatra would feel about that?"

Yes.

	Cliff asked her the question and she said no. She lied and Cliff knew it because he saw the diary.

questions.text: What does CJ's laptop do when she opens her e-mail?
questions.explanation:
Quacks.

	CJ gave Will Sawyer this information while they were both in the press room.

questions.text: Who originally said, "If the President wins, it will be on the Vice President's coat tails"?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	The statement was said in the Roosevelt room and repeated to CJ by a reporter. This caused Toby to call all of his people to the cafeteria where he gave them a talking to.

questions.text: Who asked how they could be subject to Leo?
questions.explanation:
Jed.

	Jed asked how he could be subject to Leo and Leo said he had Margaret for that.

questions.text: While Sam was finding a way to eliminate the penny, what was Leo and General Adamly doing?
questions.correct: Finding a way to eliminate genocide
questions.explanation:
Finding a way to eliminate genocide.

	After Sam found out what they were doing, he told Leo he would come back.

questions.text: What was the name of the operation that Leo flew in Vietnam?
questions.explanation:
Operation Rolling Thunder.

	In September 1966, Leo was flying a Fighterchief in a mission called Operation Rolling Thunder that killed eleven civilians. He wasn't aware that it was a civilian target he bombed.
